select1.label: GETTING READY Greet the woman respectfully and with kindness. Tell the woman what is going to be done and encourage her to ask questions Listen to what the woman has to say. Provide emotional support and reassurance

IMMEDIATE MANAGEMENT Ensure that airway is open Begin resuscitation measures, if necessary. Give oxygen at 4â€“6 L per minute by mask or cannulae Establish an IV and give normal saline or Ringer's lactate

ANTICONVULSIVE THERAPY (MAGNESIUM SULPHATE) Administering Loading Dose of Magnesium Sulphate Wash hands thoroughly with soap and water and dry Tell the woman that she may experience a feeling of warmth when magnesium sulphate is given. Draw up 10 grams of magnesium sulphate 50% solution (20 ml) with 1 ml of 2% lignocaine in the same syringe. Give 5 grams by DEEP IM injection in one buttock, replace the needle and give the remaining 5 grams by DEEP IM injection into the other buttock.

POST-PROCEDURE TASKS If disposing of needle and syringe flush it with 0.5% chlorine solution then place in puncture-proof container. Wash hands thoroughly with soap and water and dry. Arrange urgent referral so that the woman reaches the referral centre within 2 hours of receiving the first dose of Magnesium Sulphate
